Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Piscicolin 126 / Piscicocin Via (PiscV1a, Pisc126, PisA, natural AMPs; class 2a bacteriocin, Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against L. monocytogenes 4A.Chemical modification: There is a disulfide bond.Stability: Piscicolin 126 proved to be stable to high temperatures at acidic pH values. However, it was inactivated at neutral or alkaline pH values.Food preservation test: inclusion of piscicolin 126 in a commercial ham paste preparation inhibited the growth of L. monocytogenes for up to 14 days of storage at the abuse temperature of 10oC, better tnan nisin. Updated 7/2021; 4/2023
Literature Information.Author: Jack RW et al Coventry MJ1996
Literature Information.Title: Characterization of the chemical and antimicrobial properties of piscicolin 126, a bacteriocin produced by Carnobacterium piscicola JG126
